page.title: 06Beaumont Church
page.content: Beaumont is a French word which when translated means beautiful hill. The Norman Church was built in 1296 on the site of a Roman Turret, some of the Roman stones being used to build the walls of the church. Burgh-by-Sands and Beaumont were uncomfortable places in which to live because of the constant border battles. Two traditions connected with Saint Mary's Church are at weddings when the church gates are tied up. When the groom cuts the string it's supposed to bring good luck to the couple. Next, a piece of rope across the road, and the wedding cars can only pass if they give money to the children. The vicar has five local parishes and preaches in four churches and in schools. The first vicar of St. Mary's was Sir Elias de Thirlwall.
